questions.question: What is a 'Biography'?
options: A story written by a person about their own life
A detailed description of a person's life written by someone else
questions.explanation: A biography is an account of someone's life written by another person. (An autobiography is written by the subject themselves).

questions.question: Which of the following is an essential element to include in a Biography Presentation?
options: Key life events, achievements, and legacy of the subject
questions.explanation: To tell a complete story, you must include major milestones like birth, education, career achievements, and impact.

questions.question: Which PowerPoint tool is best for visually displaying the chronological order of a person's life events?
questions.explanation: SmartArt Timeline layouts are specifically designed to show a sequence of events over time.

questions.question: If you want to print your presentation so the audience can take notes, which Print Layout is best?
options: Handouts (e.g., 3 slides per page with lines)
questions.explanation: Handouts (especially the 3-slide layout) provide space next to slide thumbnails for writing notes.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] Which type of AI tool would be most useful for a biography presentation about a historical figure with damaged photos?
questions.explanation: AI photo restoration tools can repair scratches and colorize black-and-white photos to make the presentation more engaging.

questions.question: Which slide layout is ideal for showing a photo of the person alongside a bulleted list of their achievements?
questions.explanation: The 'Two Content' layout provides two placeholders side-by-side, perfect for text on one side and an image on the other.

questions.question: What is the 'Legacy' section of a biography typically about?
options: The lasting impact or influence they left on the world
questions.explanation: Legacy refers to what the person is remembered for and how they affected future generations.

questions.question: To organize a long biography presentation into chapters (e.g., 'Early Life', 'Career'), you should use:
questions.explanation: Sections allow you to group slides logically, making it easier to manage and navigate a long presentation.

questions.question: When printing, 'Grayscale' mode is useful when:
options: You want the most colorful print
You are printing on a black and white printer and want to ensure readability
You want to save the file as a video
You want to hide the text
questions.explanation: Grayscale optimizes the colors for black-and-white printing, ensuring that lighter colors don't disappear.

questions.question: Which feature helps you cite the sources of your information (e.g., Wikipedia, Books) at the bottom of a slide?
questions.explanation: Footers are commonly used to place citations, dates, or page numbers consistently on slides.

questions.question: Why is it important to check 'Copyright' when using images for a public biography presentation?
options: To ensure you have legal permission to use the photos
questions.explanation: Using copyrighted images without permission is illegal; one should look for Creative Commons or Public Domain images.

questions.question: To ensure your biography text is readable from the back of the room, you should:
options: Use a large font size (e.g., 24pt+) and high contrast
Use yellow text on a white background
questions.explanation: Legibility is key; small fonts or low contrast make the presentation useless for an audience.

questions.question: Which view allows you to see your speaker notes while the audience sees the full slide?
questions.explanation: Presenter View puts the speaker in control, showing notes and upcoming slides privately.

questions.question: What is an 'Autobiography'?
options: A biography written by a car
A biography written by the person themselves
A biography about a fictional character
questions.explanation: Auto- means self; an autobiography is a self-written life story.

questions.question: If you want to save your presentation as a document to share via email without animation, which format is best?
questions.explanation: PDFs capture the slides as static pages, making them easy to share and read on any device.

questions.question: Which ribbon tab would you use to change the slide dimensions to A4 size for a printed biography book?
questions.explanation: The Design tab's 'Slide Size' > 'Custom Slide Size' menu allows you to set dimensions like A4 or Letter.

questions.question: To add a quote from the person you are presenting about, which shape is often used?
questions.explanation: Callouts or Speech Bubbles are visual conventions for displaying spoken words or quotes.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] How can online encyclopedias like Wikipedia help in creating a biography?
options: They provide verified facts, dates, and references
They edit the PowerPoint for you
questions.explanation: Online encyclopedias are excellent starting points for gathering factual data and timelines.

questions.question: Which transition effect is generally considered professional and safe for a serious biography?
questions.explanation: Simple transitions like Fade or Wipe focus attention on the content rather than distracting the audience with flashy effects.

questions.question: If you have a video clip of the person speaking, which tab allows you to insert it?
questions.explanation: The Insert tab handles all external media, including Videos and Audio.
